text:
Gameplay > graphics. People who keep playing most Nintendo games know that for quite a while now, I guess it only takes a little bit more time before the Xbox and PS owners are crying because their consoles are filled with generic Assassin's Creed and Call of Duty games. And there's also a market for that ofcourse. But Nintendo in it's state it is now shouldn't even have to worry about the other 2, when reality tells something else.Â 

Oh btw, if you didn't make that up from my text already, I don't agree on there not being great games lately. 3D platformers have been really scarce however. Well with project Ukelele and others in the making there is some hope on the horizon again. And Mario is bigger than ever with 3D world being widely regarded as one of the best Mario games ever created. And the Galaxy games weren't so bad either...
author: Stefan

text:
I completely agree with you. Back in the days of GC/PS2/DC/XB gaming was a it's finest because it was targeting any demographic, children and adults alike.

But now, my main problem with modern gaming is that it feels too standardized to the point that if the game is not cinematic, mature or edgy then it is considered lame, childish or indie.

For example, right now I'm looking forward to Mortal Kombat X, but the trailers are trying too hard to be action movie trailers that it kills my desire to keep watching. The reason I dislike this, is because it can end up being something really pretentious.

Â Anyway, I still enjoy modern gaming withÂ  my favorites being thus far: Bayonetta, Batman Arkham Series, Darksiders & the Withcer.

text: @Dragonking1984 I'd say Gamecube was a bit of a downgrade... platformers were nearly non-existent on it. And as someone who also grew up with the NES and SNES, it was a pretty disappointing system for me. But then Wii came out and brought back classic franchises with Donkey Kong Country Returns, New Super Mario Bros Wii, Wario Land Shake it, Rayman Origins, and Kirby's Return to Dreamland and I was in heaven. The Wii deserves more credit.

@Michael PetersonÂ I do agree that the wii deserves more credit (and a name change to go with it) where i disagree however is that the gamecube was bad. a lot of people claim it was the worst nintendo console since the virtual boy. and i call bullshit. if not for the GC we would not have the Metroid prime games, super smash bros melee, that kickass resident evil 1 update, eternal darkness, legend of zelda wind waker, killer7 and other games (yes some of them where later ported Â to the wii like wind waker but they started out on the GC and got such a following that warranted them being ported.)Â

text:
Rare was never good, until the mid to late 90s. But even then, that's a stretch.

In the 80s, they were responsible for all the abominations that were made under the LJN label.

Their tenure on the Donkey Kong Country series was pretty awesome, even if they largely amounted to lame collectathons. At least the level design was good.

Banjo Kazooie? Another collectathon. Goldeneye and Perfect Dark... nothing bad to say about them. But Donkey Kong 64... worst of the bunch.
